root: ^Welcome back friend, do you have the trash I asked for?

s: ^Got it right here! I didn’t realize how dirty the mountain!

c-0: ^I’m sorry that you’re responsible for cleaning it all up but I hope I was able to help!
c-1: ^So what is it that you can offer me to help reach the summit?
c-2: ^This was a pain in the butt so the reward better be worth it.

OE1: ^maybe we could have been good friends.
^It seems we both have our purposes on this mountain.
^And right now, mine is to help you with yours.
^Your body won’t be able to make it past a certain point on the mountain, but your spirit will.
^I can grant you the ability to have your spirit move from one body to the next.
^You’ll lose your memory, but not your purpose.
^If reaching the summit is really that important to you,
^then this is what I can offer you.
OE2: ^And of course, I haven’t forgotten about your reward.
^Your body won’t be able to make it past a certain point on the mountain, but your spirit will.
^I can grant you the ability to have your spirit move from one body to the next.
^If reaching the summit is really that important to you,
^then this is what I can offer you.
OE3: ^its worth is entirely dependent on you.
^Your body won’t be able to make it past a certain point on the mountain,
^I can grant you the ability to have your spirit move from one body to the next.
^You’ll lose your memory, but not your purpose.
^If reaching the summit is really that important to you,
^then this is what I can offer you.

s: ^Well, losing my body and my memories is certainly not how I wanted to reach the top,

c-0: ^but if it’s what I have to do,
c-2: ^I have to die to reach the summit???
^It’s not how I saw this playing out,

IE1: ^There, your spirit should now be able to ascend the mountain.
^Thank you again for your help, little panda.
^I certainly won’t forget it, nor will the mountain.
^I hope your spirit finds what it’s looking for on Everest’s summit.
